results.title: Printing presses and engineering: one of our own kind
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Peter Baylis, Leslie Sansom and Vickers Films

results.title: Better ways. 4. One man and his job
results.creator_credit: Peter Morley, Denis Ward and British Productivity Council
results.brief_description: Shows application of Work Study methods. The main example is the assembly of governor elements for diesel fuel injection pumps. Reveals how a job is analysed on a two-handed chart. The film digresses to demonstrate the principles of Motion Economy shown under laboratory conditions at the Work Study School of the College of Aeronautics. The film shows how special fixtures and bench designs were fashioned, and the worker trained in the new methods. Stresses that the human factor must always be understood in Work Study.

results.title: On three moon creek: Australian paintings by Gil Jamieson
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: Gil Jamieson’s paintings of outback Queensland life, depicting drought, fire, flood, harvest, and a rodeo. The film is animated by camera movement and accompanied by a ballad written by Tim Burstall and performed by Donald Ayrton and John Earle.

results.title: On the Bowery
results.brief_description: This award-winning documentary tells about life in New York’s Bowery, the haunt of alcoholics and derelicts. No attempt is made to sensationalise; it is simply an objective, but at the same time stark and moving, account of men who have passed the point of no return and live in a half-world of cheap drink, argument, theft, card-playing and bread and soup from the local mission.

results.title: On stream
results.creator_credit: John Heyer and Shell Company of Australia
results.brief_description: Records the building of the Shell Oil Refinery at Geelong, Victoria. Shows initial stages in the cleaning, dredging and excavating of the land; the arrival of a Dutch contracting firm for the building of the one million pound distillation plant; laying of the pipeline which will carry petroleum to Melbourne. Narrated by Mungo MacCallum.

results.title: Olympia: the film of the XI Olympic Games, Berlin, 1936
results.brief_description: The official record of the XIth Olympiad held in Berlin in 1936. Beginning with a long series of classic figures depicting athletics in ancient Greece, the film continues with the bearing of the Olympic torch across the Continent of Europe to Berlin, where entry into the Reich Sport Field introduces the sections of the film recording the actual events. The “Olympiad” is a majestically conceived and executed film recording not only the sporting contests but also rendering eternal on film the charms of athletic sports, their special beauties, their grace and their power. This great film captures for all time the spirit of those sixteen glorious days when the Olympic flame burned on the arena, the bell tolled and the world’s best athletes measured their strength in stirring combat. Perhaps it is hard to forgive Leni Riefenstahl her collusion with the Nazis, but neither can we deny the inspired lyricism of her cine-spectacles. Extraordinary and inspired throughout, this film’s testament to the State’s power to colonise even beauty and poetry. Music by Herbert Windt. Commentary in German.

results.title: The Searching years: Olivia
results.brief_description: This film focuses on conflict which is sometimes violent and is common to all our lives. It uses unrehearsed role plays to explore various possibilities to overcome conflict.
